div.h3: Continuity of Education Plan- revised and updated

div.p: Good Morning Pottstown Families,

Today is the start of PMS Distance Learning! We have one more week before our elementary grade levels launch (Monday, 5/4/20). In preparation for this, the District would like to hold Google Meet video sessions with you to give you an overview of the online Google platform that your students will be using.

ul.li: The end if these meetings is fluid depending on attendance
These are overviews of how to use the Google products
These meetings will be held in Google Meet.
Make sure to use Google Chrome when joining

div.p: These are NOT for issue with your Chromebook, contact your teacher for troubleshooting and log in help.
To join these sessions, go to:

ul.li: Tuesday 4/28 5:30 to 6:30 meet.google.com/fip-qmxu-vcj
Saturday 5/2 10:00 am to 11 meet.google.com/ver-qdho-rxe
Monday 5/4 10 am to 11:00 meet.google.com/nba-hxfy-ngy
Monday 5/4 5:30 to 6:30 meet.google.com/edk-toso-xnx
Saturday 5/9 10:00 am to 11 meet.google.com/gea-voxp-bqh

p.br: Google Classroom, Drive, Chrome, Gmail, Google Account to reset passwords. For chromebook assistance, please contact your teacher. They will reach out to the tech department to help troubleshoot.

div.p: Thank you,

Stephen Rodriguez
Superintendent of Schools
Pottstown School District

span.div:
April 16, 2020
Good Morning Pottstown Families,
Please read this entire email as there are important details for all. Today, we will be rolling out technology for those who have already communicated the need. The ratio will be 2:1, one device for every two students in a household. The district contacted those families directly.
Should you have a need for either internet access or a device, (like a chromebook) and wish to sign one out from the district, please email [email protected] with details including name of each student(s), building, grade, and parent name and phone number.
Continuity of Education Plan, Phase II:
HIGH SCHOOL
New learning, including required assignments, begin 4-20-20. Attendance and assignment completion details have been sent to students and parents. All students have Chromebooks and will continue (or in a few cases, start) to use the Google Classroom Education Platform. Seniors are exempt from Contract Gym and Graduation Project Requirements. AP courses and Dual enrollment courses will continue with new learning.
MIDDLE SCHOOL
New learning, including required assignments, begin 4-27-20, one week after high school. Attendance and assignment completion details will be sent to students and parents. During the week of 4-20 to 4-24, parents and teachers will connect, and instead of enrichment, google classroom orientation activities will be given so that everyone is prepared for the 4-27-20 launch into Google Classroom.
ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS
New learning, including required assignments, begin 5-4-20, one week after middle school. Attendance and assignment completion details will be sent to students and parents. During the week of 4-20 and 4-27, parents and teachers will connect, and instead of enrichment, google classroom orientation activities will be given so that everyone is prepared for the 5-4-20 launch into Google Classroom.
PRE-K COUNTS PROGRAMS
Due to the Governor’s office instructions, and the age level, pre-k classrooms (including those at our elementary schools) will continue with enrichment and review activities. This action will keep us in compliance with the grant funded guideline for the program, as well as be consistent with the age level expectations.
SPECIAL PROGRAMS
Special programs like Virtual Learning Academy, Pottstown Leadership Learning Academy, Beech Street Learning Studio, or others are all expected to continue new learning, and begin no later than 4-20-20. You will have received communication from the directors of the programs, and should reach out with any questions directly.
NOTE
Attendance is being collected in accordance with PDE requirements, but not for purposes of truancy.
All grades for 4th quarter will be PASS/FAIL since this whole programming model is new to everyone. (PHS- Pass fail for MP3 as well)
Google Meet or Google Hangout (video) sessions may be conducted by teachers, and your student might have the opportunity (but not the obligation) to participate. Please know that for purposes of safety and equity, if a teacher uses video tools like Meet or Hangout, teachers will be recording the video sessions. Students will be reminded of this and should you have any concerns, please speak with either the teacher or school principal.
Our staff are all working at breakneck speed to learn, communicate, and deliver instruction in a brand new, balanced, but relevant way. Their dedication and love for their students is more evident than ever.
We appreciate the huge challenge this situation is for families. Yet our character as a town and a district are shining through. We are sticking together, with patience and understanding, and we will be better than ever after this crisis is over.
ONE GOAL. ONE TEAM. ONE TOWN.
Thank you,
Stephen Rodriguez
Superintendent of Schools
Pottstown School District

div.p: Hello Parents and Guardians,
While there are different food choices, the process remains identical to last week Please remember:

ul.li: Elementary Schools are the distribution points, Wednesday, 3PM to 6PM
Please wear facial masks if you are able and adhere to the social distancing guidelines (everyone has been terrific about this!)
Please bring your reusable bags. Other donations may be available for families.
Honor system still in place, get what you need for Pottstown students.

div.p: We have made a few changes from our yearly calendar regarding 3rd marking period report cards:

ul.li: 3rd marking period officially ended March 27, 2020.
We have extended the due date for all 3rd marking period work until Monday, April 20, 2020.
Home Access Center closes Friday, April 17, 2020 (parents will be unable to view grades until Report Cards are released)
Report Cards will be available on Home Access Center Wednesday, April 29, 2020

div.p: Our teachers and administrators thank you for your patience and assistance as we work through all of the questions regarding this new teaching model of remote learning. Now more than ever we need your help to assist children with the learning process. Our motto of One Goal, One Team, One Town has never been more accurate.
Thank you,
Stephen Rodriguez Superintendent of Schools Pottstown School District
Good Afternoon Pottstown Families,

At 10:30 a.m. this morning, Secretary of Education Pedro Rivera has announced that all K-12 Schools, Higher Education Institutions, Pre-Schools, and Pre-K Counts Programs will remain closed through the end of the 2019-2020 Academic Year. Governor Wolf will be announcing this publicly later today.

Having anticipated this, the Pottstown School District will be transitioning to a fully remote learning model for all grade levels, in stages. Pottstown High School will be first to begin new learning, beginning April 20th. Technology gaps for families in Middle and Elementary Schools will be addressed next week, and we are preparing our district online learning platform through Google Classroom.

Meanwhile, the enrichment opportunities our teaching staff have developed are more important than ever. Please take some time to work with your children on these review and enrichment activities, and consider creating a “daily schedule” dedicated to learning. Don’t hesitate to reach out to your teacher for support. They want to connect with you!

I recognize this will be a large adjustment for all of us and many will feel uncomfortable and uneasy about the future. Our strength and ability to overcome this challenging time will be found in our support for each other. Together we will become stronger and better for the experience and have another reason to say proud to be from Pottstown.
Thank you. Happy Spring Break, and Stay Safe,

Stephen J. Rodriguez
Superintendent of Schools
Pottstown School District
Good Afternoon Pottstown Families,

MASK USAGE- Governor Wolf called for the voluntary usage of cloth masks for all citizens in the commonwealth effective immediately. Therefore, our volunteers and staff will wear masks while distributing food or exercising other functions in the community.

We ask that all individuals picking up food would also wear a cloth mask. Remember, this must be done in conjunction with social distancing, and no one should contaminate their mask by taking it on and off or touching it with your hands.

CONTINUITY OF EDUCATION- This week and next, students are being given quality enrichment and review activities every day. Too many of our families have not taken advantage of these opportunities. Certainly, some families have hardships, but if you are able, we ask that you have your children participate as much as possible. If the school closure lasts as long as we all fear, it will be critical that students continue to make academic progress.

TECHNOLOGY- Thank you to all who responded to one of our three technology surveys. We have been able to identify families in need of internet connections and devices to help their students access education. Those families will be contacted with distribution instructions. Meanwhile, our staff continues to deliver instruction in a distance learning model. Please do your best to give students every opportunity to engage in the review and enrichment activities. Should you know or be in contact with any family lacking internet access, device access, or not receiving district communication, please ask them to email: [email protected]

FOOD DISTRIBUTION- Just like last week, families may pick up food at each of our elementary schools on Wednesday, from 3pm to 6pm. Please bring your bags. Please wear your facemask. Thanks to the generosity of community partners there will be donations of other items for distribution.

I am encouraged with the strength and commitment demonstrated by so many in our community to come together in helping us all face these very challenging times. We will persevere and be stronger for the experience.
Thank you Happy Spring Break, and Stay Safe,

Stephen J. Rodriguez
Superintendent of Schools
Pottstown School District
Good Morning Pottstown Families,

During the food distribution at elementary schools from 3pm to 6pm today, there will be paper packets of enrichment activities for every grade level from Prek-8th grade. There are not nearly enough for everyone.

strong.span: PLEASE, only take these printed materials if you have no internet access, or no device to access the activities teachers are sending.

div.p: Just as we are doing with food, this is based on the honor system. No questions will be asked, but please keep the paper copies for those students who need them.

Thank you and Stay Safe, Stephen J. Rodriguez
Superintendent of Schools
Pottstown School District
Good Afternoon Pottstown Families,
Food Distribution will again be on Wednesday, (Tomorrow):

ul.li: Pick up hours at each elementary school will continue to be from 3 PM to 6 PM
Food distribution will be similar to last week, but in order to be “weatherproof” we will now use the Gym at each of our elementary schools.
Entry to the Gym will be controlled and organized, but it should not take more than a few moments to pick up food. Social Distancing procedures should be better than ever with our new set-up.
You may bring your reusable bag from last week, or there will be some bags available as well.

Clear directions will be given at each site so that when families pick up food, they can do so in an organized fashion with no one touching food products. Products will be straight from the food distribution box to limit any touching. The family member picking up food will simply take the items as per the directions. Bags will be provided.
Remember to take items for each student in your household. We continue to operate on the honor system. No questions asked.
Certain companies have reached out to donate food items which we will make available at each site. Please follow directions at the tables for these items.
Please park and leave carefully as we have a combination of drivers and walkers at each site.

div.p: Everyone has done a terrific job at being cordial and safe during these food distribution days. We are a strong community and appreciate your support and caring for one another!
Thank you and Stay Safe,

Stephen J. Rodriguez
Superintendent of Schools
Pottstown School District
Good Afternoon Pottstown Families,
As you will no doubt hear from news agencies, Governor Tom Wolf declared all schools will remain closed until further notice but at least until April 30.

We continue to work on our continuity of education plan and you should have been contacted by your students’ teacher today. Thank you for all you are doing to help students engage in the activities sent!
We will also provide information on our upgraded food distribution plan that will be “weatherproof” and better control social distancing.
Thank you and Stay Safe,

Stephen J. Rodriguez
Superintendent of Schools
Pottstown School District
Good Afternoon Pottstown Families,

With the extended school closure and new laws being passed to deal with this state and national crisis, I would like to update you on some important items. We are releasing and enacting a ‘Continuity of Education’ Plan which will focus on both short and long term plans and actions.

ul.li: For the past few days, teachers and administrators have been organizing and preparing material for your students to complete.

At the end of the day Friday( March 27), we will be shutting down the public enrichment page featured on our website, as we will be offering students activities which may require licensing and/or copyrighted material.

On Monday morning (March 30), teachers and educational staff will contact students/families with organized review and enrichment activities based on material from the classroom. This will not include new curriculum material at this stage of the plan. However, there will be resources and activities to help students and we highly encourage all students & families to treat the activities provided seriously. We are designing the activities to be “user friendly,” engaging and not difficult to complete.

Pre-k through 6th grade will receive one (1) Language Arts and one (1) Math activity per day until spring break, which begins Thursday, 4/9/20. If the closure is extended, the activities will continue into the next week.
7th-12th grades will receive activities based on student course: English, Math, Science, Social Studies, etc..
Counseling services will be made available to those who were previously using them. Mental Health is still critically important, and our counselors will be available to the extent this crisis allows.
Teachers will be available for support at certain times, both in the morning and afternoon, each day we would otherwise be open. They will communicate specific times.
Special Education teachers, and related service providers will be reaching out to families to support students in multiple ways.
Look for correspondence from teachers through email, Class Tag (Middle School), Google Classroom (High School), or other previously used communication platforms this Monday 3/30/20.
If you lack either internet access, or a device (chrome book), please complete our survey (if you have not already), here: https://www.pottstownschools.org/internetsurvey.aspx
Preliminary results indicate 95% of our district has access to the Internet and about 80% report having some sort of computer or device for students. See below for more resources:

FREE HOTSPOTS IF IN RANGE:
https://wifi.xfinity.com/?rid=5169196695&mid=20200323_Adhoc_CM_Crisis_DWWeekl

60 DAYS FREE OF COMCAST:
https://corporate.comcast.com/press/releases/internet-essentials-low-income-broadband-coronavirus-pandemic

For those who don’t have access to internet or devices, the district will provide a limited number of paper copy activities for each grade level available during food distribution times,each Wednesday at all four of the elementary buildings from 3pm-6pm. There will be paper copies for any parent that does not have access otherwise. We ask that parents who have other means to not take the paper copies so that we don’t run out.
Participation is still voluntary, but you are highly encouraged to help your students engage with these activities so they are prepared for a return to required education.

Should the school closure continue into the foreseeable future, we are planning to accommodate parents and students to the best of our ability and would then begin to move into new work and curriculum. Your cooperation will be critical.

We are exploring our current chrome book device availability so that we can re-assign classroom sets to families who have need, especially at the 5-8 grade level. We still won’t be able to meet the need of the 20% of parents that have indicated they have no device.
We are investigating the purchase of more devices, but there is considerable wait time.
Unless schools are ordered back into session we are coordinating efforts on a plan to end the 3rd Quarter, and begin 4th Quarter with education delivered remotely.

div.p: This situation is continually changing, and we will respond as we know more. Meanwhile, please stay alert for more information in the coming days, and thank you for adhering to the social distancing protocols and mitigation efforts under way.
Our country and community will get through this together.
Thank you and Stay Safe,

Stephen J. Rodriguez
Superintendent of Schools
Pottstown School District

div.span: Information about the coronavirus outbreak is spreading fast, but what do we actually know about the illness? CBC News medical contributor and family physician Dr. Peter Lin breaks down the facts about what it is, where it came from, how it spreads and what you can do to protect yourself.
